reviewText: First, this concert looks just beautiful in high-definition.  You can see all the details in the Indian rugs on which the band stands, for instance. It also sounds pretty darn good, too, thanks to the terrific musicians in Tom Petty's band. Mike Campbell on lead guitar and Benmont Tench on keyboards were particularly good, I thought.Petty has never had that good a voice but yet he's interesting to hear and he comes across as a real likable guy. All of the group's members, which also include bassist Ron Blair and guitar-harmonic-harmony vocals Scott Thurston and drummer Steve Ferrone all look like they're having a good time. I suspect they usually do when they're playing.Everybody has their favorites songs of each artist and group and, at least in this concert, mine was "Melinda," which featured fantastic piano by Tench and an interesting guitar sound from Campbell. You can't go wrong either with rock "oldies" like "Baby, Please Don't Go" and "Born In Chicago," "Red Rooster" and "I Got A Woman." There is a good mix of fast and slow, rock and blues and ballads.....all adding up to an entertaining show.
summary: Good Mix & Musicians Make It An Entertaining Show

reviewText: While our music/movie room gets more use from operas and classical music, I do have a few rock and jazz blu-rays (Chris Botti, Legends of Jazz, Dave Matthews and Tim Reynolds etc.)I saw part of this performance on TV in my living room with only a 4.0 setup, but I liked it enough to order the blu-ray.Upon hearing the DTS-MA sound track now twice in our 7.1 setup, I found the recording mix a tad unbalanced. The rhythm guitar on the right when viewed from the audience is often not loud enough compared to all the other instruments/voices.You can hear it best when comparing "I got a woman" to "13 days". The mix on "13 days" is much better.Everything else is well recorded and I still enjoyed it. But it can get only 4 stars from me.
summary: The rhythm guitar on the right is a bit underrecorded

reviewText: The most underrated Blu-ray release I have found in quite some time. With hardly any fanfare this gem slipped into my collection last week. What the case nor slipcover say is that the audio is DTS-HD MA and wow.. does she shine. Video is fantastic also. I am not a huge Petty fan but I am becoming one with this concert.The songlist:Baby please don't goCrawling back to youHandle with careI won't back downI'm cryin'Angel dreamMelindaBorn in ChicagoRed RoosterCarolRefugeeLove is a long roadYou don't know how it feelsBlack leather womanI done somebody wrongI got a womanThirteen daysWake up timeRollin' in my sweet baby's armsLost childrenTwo men talkin'You wreck meAn additional 8 songs in the extras which are also concert footage, some from the Sound Stage concert and some from a different concert. All of these are also DTS-HD MA. If you are a Petty fan or not you will get much enjoyment from this disc. Finally some good music on Blu-ray is here!
Title: N/A
